snippet: The prime minister says having an official aircraft for government business is a security and money-saving measure, but others see an attempt to keep up appearances with other world leaders.
abstract: British citizens are nonplussed by news that government will convert military plane into Prime Min David Cameron's official aircraft, even amid effort to slash public spending; government asserts plan has security and advantages, while skeptics see misplaced bid for prestige.
lead_paragraph: The prime minister says having an official aircraft for government business is a security and money-saving measure, but others see an attempt to keep up appearances with other world leaders.

headline.main: Official Plane for Cameron Has Britons Unimpressed
headline.print_headline: Official Plane for Cameron Has Britons Unimpressed
